title: Sales Incentive Administrator
description:
Personal development and becoming the best you is all about growth and exploring new skills and opportunities – both in and out of the office. At Accruent, we call this Grow Without Limits, and we’re proud to offer each of our employees the resources, coaching and support necessary to achieve Growth Without Limits in their personal and professional lives. Explore where the path takes you. 

A Sales Incentive Administrator plays a crucial role in supporting a company's sales team by managing and administering various sales incentive programs. Their primary responsibility is to participate in design of incentive plans and SPIFs, and to implement, and maintain incentive programs that motivate sales representatives and drive revenue growth.

Job Title: Sales Incentive Administrator

Job Summary: The Sales Incentive Administrator is responsible for managing, and administering sales incentive programs to motivate and reward the sales team for achieving targets and objectives! They will work closely with the Sales, Finance and Payroll teams to ensure that incentive programs are effective in driving sales performance.

Key Responsibilities:

  1. Data Analysis: Collect and analyze sales performance data to determine program effectiveness and make data-driven decisions for program improvements.
  2. Communication: Clearly communicate program details, rules, and expectations to the sales team, ensuring they understand the incentive structure.
  3. Documentation: Maintain comprehensive records of incentive program rules, terms, and documentation.
  4. Eligibility Management: Ensure that sales representatives meet the eligibility criteria to participate in incentive programs and address any eligibility concerns.
  5. Calculations: Accurately calculate and validate incentive payments based on predefined criteria, such as quotas, commissions, bonuses, and other performance metrics.
  6. Reporting: Generate regular reports and summaries of incentive program results, performance, and payouts for management and team members.
  7. Compliance: Ensure that incentive programs follow legal and regulatory requirements, as well as company policies.
  8. Feedback and Improvement: Collaborate with the sales team to gather feedback on incentive programs and make necessary adjustments for continuous improvement.
  9. Conflict Resolution: Address and resolve disputes and inquiries related to incentive calculations or program rules.
  10. Technology Utilization: Use software and tools, including CRM and incentive management software, to automate and streamline the administration of incentive programs.
  11. Training and Support: Provide training and support to sales representatives to help them understand the incentive program and maximize their earnings.

Qualifications:

  1. Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in business, finance, or a related field.
  2. Previous experience in sales incentive administration or a similar role.
  3. Strong analytical and data management skills.
  4. Proficiency in using CRM, Excel and incentive management software.
  5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  6. Attention to detail and accuracy in incentive calculations.
  7. Knowledge of sales processes and incentive standard methodologies.
  8. Understanding of legal and compliance regulations related to sales incentives.
  9. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  10. Problem-solving and conflict resolution skills.
  11. Strong organizational and time management abilities.

Please Note:

  • This job may require travel domestically and/or internationally, 
  • This is a full-time, exempt opportunity. 
  • Relocation will not be considered for this position. 
  • At this time, visa sponsorship is not available. 

Base pay offered may vary depending on various factors, including, but not limited to: job-related knowledge; skills; experience; and other eligibility factors such as geographic location. The Total Rewards package includes competitive base pay and an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and several programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.

ABOUT ACCRUENT

At Accruent (a subsidiary or affiliate of Fortive Corporation), we strive to be on the cutting edge of the software world, providing purpose-built intelligent solutions that raise customer expectations, shift paradigms and transform the way businesses operate and achieve success.

We aim to provide the same transformational growth for our 1,000+ employees which includes a vibrant office culture in major cities like Austin and Amsterdam – and 10,000 customers in more than 150 countries – we know you’ll gain new experiences along the way. In our continued effort to help our teams Grow Without Limits, we provide all employees with the resources, coaching and support they need to reach new heights and experience true professional and personal development – and we do this because we believe it will help us grow as a global company in return.

Every person can bring something incredible to the table, and we can always achieve more together. So, if you are courageous, adaptable, collaborative and interested in becoming the best you, we encourage you to join us for the ride – even if you don’t believe you have the exact experience to fill a particular role.

Explore the path. Join Accruent.

ABOUT FORTIVE

Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.

We are a global industrial technology innovator with a startup spirit. Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies. We’re a force for progress, working alongside our customers and partners to solve challenges on a global scale, from workplace safety in the most demanding conditions to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.

We are a diverse team 17,000 strong, united by a dynamic, inclusive culture and energized by limitless learning and growth. We use the proven Fortive Business System (FBS) to accelerate our positive impact.

At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential—your ability to learn, grow, and make a difference. At Fortive, we believe in us. We believe in the power of people working together to solve problems no one could solve alone. At Fortive, we believe in growth. We’re honest about what’s working and what isn’t, and we never stop improving and innovating.

Fortive: For you, for us, for growth.

Fortive Corporation and all Fortive Companies are proud to be equal opportunity employers. We value and encourage diversity and solicit applications from all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or other characteristics protected by law. Fortive and all Fortive Companies are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should ask to speak with a Human Resources representative to request an accommodation.

title: Account Services Specialist
description:
About AutoFi 
AutoFi is the leading provider of digital commerce technology that powers the
sales and finance experiences for the most innovative brands and dealers in
automotive. The AutoFi platform enables a more transactional buying experience
with $4B in funded loans processed through AutoFi annually. AutoFi’s dynamic
selling platform empowers dealers to sell vehicles more efficiently and
profitably, both online and in the showroom. 
We are funded for years of future growth and backed by investors including
Crosslink Capital, Santander Holdings USA, SVB Financial Group, Ford, BMW
iVentures and Mouro Capital.


Our team is diverse - spread out across the U.S. and Canada, we have backgrounds
from finance and technology as well as deep experience in all areas of the auto
space. We’re empathetic, gritty, curious, and humble owners of this business and
are supported by some of the biggest names in the auto and financial industries
as commercial partners. We’ve never been more excited about the opportunity in
front of us to help transition the auto industry from offline to online. If
changing a trillion-dollar industry sounds exciting, we’d love to hear from you.


For more information, visit www.autofi.com [http://www.autofi.com].


About the Role 
Reporting to the Head of Account Services, the Account Services Specialist plays
a key role in our Client’s platform performance success.  Each member of our
team is challenged to contribute in a variety of capacities across the entire
organization and show their individual strengths, from product to customer
experience.


They are responsible for accurate and timely account configurations for new
clients. This includes all implementation communications beginning with Sales,
Dealer/Partner, and Performance Management, account settings, testing, quality
assurance and integrations. Primary functions include internal and external
communications to confirm understanding of requested set ups, account
configurations, integration activations with external parties, customized
settings and integrations where required, thorough testing and QA process
execution, and new launch reviews with dealer/partner and internal team. 


Account Specialists are responsible for all initiatives required from
start-to-finish to implement a new dealer, they are segmented into Roles for
additional expertise designed to optimize the Dealer/Partner launch success.
These Roles include: Dealer/Partner Communications primarily responsible for
discussions with Sales, Dealer/Partner, Performance management to confirm
optimized set up and to meet expectations from checklist through QA and launch;
Integrations/Settings primarily responsible for middleman, inventory, F&I
product variable pricing, website, post-launch script and billing integrations,
checklist/lender settings and integration testing; Technical/Product primarily
responsible for scraping sites, CTA set up, payment accuracy and testing, and
F&I product set up.


An ideal candidate will have a strong implementation or account support
background with aptitude and experience in technical configurations; as well as
internal and external communication skills across technical or non-technical
audiences.  


Additional Account Services Specialist tasks frequently include internal and
external reporting, maintenance items, training and other projects as assigned.




RERSPONSIBILITIES

 * Guide clients through the integration, configuration, testing, QA and launch
   phases of implementation and post-launch requirements. 
 * Evaluate client needs, develop configuration(s) that support optimized launch
   and business processes. 
 * Define and execute on delivery, implementation and post-launch plans. 
 * Test and troubleshoot final system setups, conduct QA for both
   implementation, launch and post-launch ensuring it meets internal and
   customer expectations. 
 * Provide end-user support during the implementation and launch process.
 * Assist Performance Management for account maintenance and other internal
   teams when needed.


QUALIFICATIONS

 * Prior Implementation or Account Support experience
 * Ability to identify requirements, implement product settings and QA in a
   complex environment
 * Basic knowledge, able to read and modify HTML, JSON, CSS and API calls or
   other scripting languages
 * You are able to manage multiple projects at varying stages simultaneously 
 * You are detail oriented and can effectively manage complex projects 
 * You work well autonomously as well as part of a team 
 * You can think through and solve ambiguous technical problems


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

 * Experience in automotive (particularly dealership), lending or SAAS digital
   retailing
 * Provide assistance in scoping projects or developing proposals. 
 * Proven ability define new processes, and optimize existing workflows 
 * You are proficient in Salesforce, MS Excel and Google apps

AutoFi is an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment are
considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex,
marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual
orientation, gender identity or other protected status under all applicable
laws, regulations, and ordinances. 


Personal Information submitted as part of your application is subject to our
website privacy policy, located at https://www.autofi.com/privacy-policy/
[https://www.autofi.com/privacy-policy/]

title: Senior Account Manager
description:
About Checkr
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized as one of BuiltIn's 2023 Best Places to Work in the US and is a Y Combinator 2023 Breakthrough Company and Top Company by Valuation.

Checkr is seeking a Senior Account Manager with proven relationship management experience to monitor our clients' needs and ensure they receive products and services on time. In this role, your responsibilities are to manage our Enterprise accounts while partnering with Customer Success to ensure customer happiness and health. You must closely monitor client portfolios and work to recognize opportunities for increasing company revenue while in parallel managing the end to end renewal process.

What you’ll do

  • Cultivate relationships with clients to ensure their satisfaction with our products and services
  • Review client portfolios and communicate upgrades or other opportunities that may benefit them
  • Work closely with Customer Success to maintain customer health and identify risk

What you bring

  • A bachelor's degree in business or marketing (preferred)
  • At least 3 years of proven account management experience
  • Skills in customer relationship management, proposal writing, and portfolio management
  • Strong negotiation and communication skills
  • Experience using CRM software (Salesforce and Outreach preferred)

What you’ll get

  • A fast-paced and collaborative environment
  • Learning and development allowance
  • Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
  • 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
  • Flexible PTO policy
  • Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

One of Checkr’s core values is Transparency. To live by that value, we’ve made the decision to disclose salary ranges in all of our job postings. We use geographic cost of labor as an input to develop ranges for our roles and as such, each location where we hire may have a different range. If this role is remote, we have listed the top to the bottom of the possible range, but we will specify the target range for an exact location when you are selected for a recruiting discussion. For more information on our compensation philosophy, see our website.

The on-target earnings for this role is $142,214 to $296,010.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr

Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.   

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: Business Consultant (India, Remote)
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Lynx Analytics was founded in 2010 by a group of INSEAD students and professors with a strong research background in graph analytics. Several of our founders since then became professors and faculty directors of analytics centers at leading US universities. Our founding purpose? To apply graph theory to simplify and solve complex, real-world business problems.

Our mission has evolved over the years, and we currently offer a range of cutting edge data analytics and AI solutions to help companies transform their operations and optimise their commercial performance. Back then, graph theory was mostly the purview of social networking sites. We wanted to expand this technology and help companies leverage their communities to unlock greater growth.

Lynx has offices in Singapore, US, Hong Kong, Hungary, and operations in several other countries such as Canada, Germany, Indonesia. We work with some of the world’s largest companies and are constantly looking to expand our knowledge base and geographical footprint. Lynx Analytics’ technology is deployed with various Clients internationally and has significant growth potential.

We have a diverse and inclusive global team comprising Professors, PhDs, MSc’s, and MBAs from Ivy Leagues, INSEAD and NUS with a broad spectrum of experience in start-ups and blue-chip companies (Google, Databricks, ZS, Abbvie, Amgen, Vodafone, Morgan Stanley, Palantir, Katana Graph to name but a few). It is the combination of our industry insight and experience, scalable proprietary technology, and highly qualified people that drives our compelling value proposition.

We are looking for ambitious, innovative, empathetic and relentless team players to explore the career opportunities that we offer as we continue to scale our operations.

 

ROLE SUMMARY

As a Business Consultant at Lynx, your primary role is to oversee our commercial projects, ensuring their successful journey from conception to full implementation.

Your key responsibilities will encompass the entire project cycle, including defining critical milestones, resource planning, task allocation, mapping dependencies, and, most importantly, ensuring the timely delivery of results. You'll be the driving force behind our project execution, ensuring that our clients' objectives are met, and their expectations exceeded.

If you thrive on taking ownership of projects and leading them to successful outcomes, we invite you to consider a career with Lynx. This role is a unique opportunity to contribute your project management expertise and make a tangible impact on our clients' businesses. Join us in delivering excellence one project at a time.

 

WHAT THIS INVOLVES

  • Accountability for end to end project delivery including commercial KPIs such as timely delivery, keeping within budget and at margin 
  • Leading all project stages including - contracting, scoping & kick-off, execution and post implementation reviews
  • Collaborating with legal, business development, product and technical teams to ensure seamless execution
  • Work with clients, technical staff and management to determine and resolve issues associated with project implementation 
  • Function as the liaison between our clients and our technical teams throughout the solution implementation cycle 
  • Building a strong relationship of trust and credibility with relevant client stakeholders both for the project and for Lynx as a company
  • Build a motivating and collegiate working environment with the team aligned to our company’s core values

 

SKILLS, QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE 

  • A Bachelor’s Degree is required, preferably in a business discipline
  • Experience in a Consultant role with Client Management and Project Management responsibilities 
  • Industry experience in the Healthcare sector either in a consulting or industry role
  • Strategic Thinking Capabilities; able to understand, analyse and solve complex problems 
  • Proven ability to liaise with internal software development teams and translate client requirements into technical specifications
  • Excellent communication skills (written, verbal & presentation) with strong negotiation and influencing abilities 
  • Willingness to travel

The following would be advantageous: 

  • Experience in leading teams and resources like data scientists and data engineers
  • Commercial analytics within the healthcare domain 
  • Knowledge of predictive analytics, and Big Data technology

title: Senior Benefits Specialist - Temporary
description:
Temporary - Part Time

Omada Health is on a mission to inspire and engage people in lifelong health, one step at a time. 

Job overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Benefits Specialist to join our HR team for a defined project duration. The Senior Benefits Specialist will be responsible for managing and coordinating our employee benefits programs, ensuring compliance with regulations, and providing exceptional support to our employees during this temporary assignment. This is a part time role (24 hours a week) with the duration of this assignment at about 5 to 6 months.

Your dedication and expertise as a benefits specialist will play a crucial role in ensuring the success of our benefits programs and the overall well-being of our employees during this temporary assignment. If you are passionate about benefits administration, compliance, and making a positive impact on our workforce, we invite you to apply!

About you:

  • You have a minimum of 3-5 years of experience working in Human Resources with 2+ years of direct experience working on benefits in the US.
  • You have strong skills in Excel/Google Sheets to conduct benefit audits, ensuring accuracy and compliance, as well as for performing comprehensive data analysis to identify trends, discrepancies, and opportunities for program improvement. 
  • You have hands-on experience with Workday benefits and absence modules, including troubleshooting and reporting within the platform. 
  • You are well-versed in utilizing Google Business Suite for email, calendar, and document management. Your expertise in leveraging these tools streamlines communication, collaboration, document organization, contributing to a more efficient and productive work environment. 
  • You have a deep understanding of employee benefits administration, including compliance with federal and state regulations (e.g., ERISA, ACA, HIPAA). Your prior experience demonstrates your ability to manage benefits programs effectively. 
  • You understand the importance of handling sensitive employee information with the utmost discretion and confidentiality, adhering to strict data privacy and security protocols.
  • You are an effective communicator, capable of explaining benefits options and changes to employees in a clear and approachable manner. 
  • You thrive in identifying and resolving challenges related to benefits administration. Your proactive approach allows you to address issues promptly, ensuring a seamless benefits experience for our employees.
  • You approach challenges with a solution-oriented mindset, always seeking ways to improve processes and optimize the employee experience.

Your impact:

  • Oversee and manage the day to day administration of Omada’s benefits programs.
  • Efficiently monitor and maintain Workday leave of absence by promptly updating them based on notifications received from our leave of absence management vendor.
  • Assist employees with benefits-related inquiries and issue resolution.
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders and external vendors to ensure seamless delivery of benefits and resolve any operational issues.
  • Manage our wellbeing program in partnership with our wellness vendor - sending out monthly wellbeing newsletters, coordinate wellness initiatives, manage wellness incentives and track reimbursements.
  • Stay updated on federal, state, and local laws governing employee benefits, ensuring that our programs remain compliant.
  • Thoroughly and accurately complete compliance reporting and necessary filings in accordance with regulatory requirements (e.g., non-discrimination testing, HCSO, ACA, 5500 preparation, and other legal reporting requirements).
  • Liaise with benefit vendors and providers to address inquiries, resolve issues, and support contract negotiations.
  • Monitor vendor performance and recommend improvements as necessary.
  • Perform regular audits and review to verify data accuracy, benefit plan compliance and adherence to regulatory standards.

Bonus Points for:

Workday Customization Proficiency: Expertise in customizing Workday benefits and absence modules to meet specific needs, including the ability to create custom reports and configurations.Wellness Program Leadership: Proven success in developing and leading comprehensive employee wellness initiatives that have positively impacted employee health and well-being.

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Remote first work from home culture
  • Generous time off policy to help you rest, recharge, and connect with loved ones
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance (and above market employer contributions)
  • Work from Home stipend
  • ...and more!



It takes a village to change health care. As we build together toward our mission, we strive to embody the following values in our day-to-day work. We hope these hold meaning for you as well as you consider Omada!

  • Start with Trust. We listen closely and we operate with kindness. We provide respectful and candid feedback to each other.
  • Seek Context. We ask to understand and we build connections. We do our research up front to move faster down the road.
  • Act Boldly. We innovate daily to solve problems, improve processes, and find new opportunities for our members and customers.
  • Deliver Results. We reward impact above output. We set a high bar, we’re not afraid to fail, and we take pride in our work.
  • Succeed Together. We prioritize Omada’s progress above team or individual. We have fun as we get stuff done, and we celebrate together. 
  • Remember Why We’re Here. We push through the challenges of changing health care because we know the destination is worth it.

About Omada Health: Omada is a virtual-first chronic care provider that nurtures lifelong health, one day at a time. Our care teams implement clinically-validated behavior change protocols for individuals with prediabetes, diabetes, hypertension, and musculoskeletal issues for consistent improvements that stack up. With more than a decade of experience and data, and 24 peer-reviewed publications that showcase our clinical and economic results, we improve health outcomes and help contain healthcare costs. 

Our scope exceeds 1,800 customers, including health plans, health systems, and employers ranging in size from small businesses to Fortune 500s. Omada is the first virtual provider to join the Institute for Healthcare Improvement’s Leadership Alliance, reflecting our aim to complement primary care providers for the benefit of our members, and affirming our guarantee to every partner: Omada works different.

Omada is thrilled to share that we’ve been certified as a Great Place to Work! Please click here for more information.

We carefully hire the best talent we can find, which means actively seeking diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and ways of thinking. We strive to build an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated and leveraged to inform better design and business decisions. Omada is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition, family care status, military or veteran status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.

 

Below is a summary of salary ranges for this role in the following geographies:

California, New York State and Washington State Base Compensation Ranges: $58.46/hr - $$73.08/hr*, Colorado Base Compensation Ranges: $52.62/hr - $65.81/hr*. Other states may vary.

*The actual offer, including the compensation package, is determined based on multiple factors, such as the candidate's skills and experience, and other business considerations.

Please click here for more information on our Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Research Associate
description:
WHO WE ARE: 

ActBlue is a nonprofit that builds tech and infrastructure for Democratic campaigns, progressive-aligned causes, and people trying to make an impact in order to fuel long-term, people-powered change. If you’ve ever given online to a Democrat or progressive organization, chances are you’ve used our powerful online fundraising platform.

We put power in the hands of small-dollar donors and help thousands of groups — from presidential candidates to environmental organizations — build grassroots movements. We envision a democracy where everyone looking to make progressive people-powered change can easily and effectively deploy their resources, energy, and creativity to shape our country and futures. Each and every one of us, from the political activists to the tech innovators to the customer service pros, is fully committed to our mission.

THE OPPORTUNITY: 

The Research Associate is part of the Research team within the Communications and Marketing Department. The Research Associate will help ActBlue in its mission by researching prospective users, contributing to media monitoring and external communication projects, and fulfilling other research requests as needed. The Associate will primarily be responsible for handling incoming vetting requests from departments across ActBlue.

WHAT YOU WILL DO: 

  • Using latest research techniques and tools, help organization determine if organizations fall within user policies by being part of a vetting operation;
  • Conduct research on prospective ActBlue users including public records research, campaign finance analysis, social media review, and news searches; 
  • Use a variety of research tools, such as LexisNexis, Illumis, and campaign finance databases, to fulfill vetting requests as well as being on the forefront of new tools that could help with research and vetting;
  • Assist the Communications team in fact-checking by providing research in rapid response moments;
  • Assist with ongoing media monitoring projects and external communication needs;
  • Prepare pre-emptive research around small-dollar donors and issues affecting our various users or ActBlue;
  • Be a project manager and participant for opposition research, misinformation, and self-research for the organization as assigned;
  • Assist with any other research assignments and projects as needed

WHAT YOU BRING:

  • 1-3 years working in a professional environment;
  • Experience working in a campaign or opposition research setting;
  • Experience vetting candidates or organizations preferred;
  • Experience using research tools such as LexisNexis, campaign finance databases, advanced social media search tools, advanced Google searches, PACER, or Illumis preferred;
  • Experience working in a press or communications setting preferred;
  • Strong copy editing and writing skills;
  • Experience working in a fast paced, problem solving role; 
  • Self-starter mentality: capable of working independently, but motivated by watching your work contribute to ActBlue’s goals and mission; 
  • Clear and compassionate written and verbal communications skill set; 
  • Strong organizational skills, with keen attention to detail and high fidelity to follow up and follow through on commitments; 
  • Ability to handle confidential information 

LOCATION AND COMPENSATION 

This posting is for a full-time, remote, salaried position. Travel may be required on a limited basis to attend all-staff and departmental retreats (1-2 times per year). Additional travel may be required for select positions. ActBlue is currently authorized to support remote work employees in Arizona, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kentucky, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia, Washington, Washington D.C., Wisconsin and Wyoming. 

Salary Range Details:

Salary Range: $65,000-$76,500

ActBlue is committed to consistent compensation practices across our organization.  Final salary offers will take into account factors such as candidate experience, interview performance and current team salary parity. 

BENEFITS:

  • Flexible work schedules and an unlimited time-off policy
  • Fully paid and trans-inclusive health, dental, and vision insurance for employees and their families; plus fully-paid health reimbursement arrangement to use for out of pocket expenses and fully-paid short- and long-term disability 
  • Fully paid basic and AD&D life insurance and a voluntary supplemental life insurance option
  • Dependent and health care flexible spending account options
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP) benefits for employees 
  • Automatic 2% Employer-paid 401K contribution, plus up to an additional 6% match on employee contributions
  • A minimum of three months paid medical, family and parental leave (for all new parents, adoptions included)
  • Commuter or home-office benefits, including a $1,000 home-office setup allowance for all new full-time remote employees
  • Additional perks including quarterly snack deliveries and digital subscriptions to the Boston Globe & New York Times

ActBlue is unable to sponsor work visas at this time.

Bargaining Unit position: The terms and conditions of this position are subject to a collective bargaining agreement with the Campaign Workers Guild, the exclusive bargaining agent of covered ActBlue employees.

INCLUSION STATEMENT:

ActBlue is deeply committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity. We commit to retaining, developing, recruiting, and hiring a diverse staff community. We honor the dignity of all. We celebrate their unique qualities. And we recognize the wide range of human differences, backgrounds, and intersectional identities that enrich the workspace and help us better meet our mission. If you feel a connection to our mission and see your interests reflected in this job description we encourage you to apply - even if you don’t meet every requirement. 

ActBlue is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities throughout the interview and employment process, including using our online system to apply for a position. If you would like to request an accommodation, please contact us at recruitment@actblue.com to get started.

*ActBlue will never ask candidates to buy equipment, nor will we email from anything other than an actblue.com or actbluetech.com email address.

title: Press Associate
description:
WHO WE ARE: 

ActBlue is a nonprofit that builds tech and infrastructure for Democratic campaigns, progressive-aligned causes, and people trying to make an impact in order to fuel long-term, people-powered change. If you’ve ever given online to a Democrat or progressive organization, chances are you’ve used our powerful online fundraising platform.

We put power in the hands of small-dollar donors and help thousands of groups — from presidential candidates to environmental organizations — build grassroots movements. We envision a democracy where everyone looking to make progressive people-powered change can easily and effectively deploy their resources, energy, and creativity to shape our country and futures. Each and every one of us, from the political activists to the tech innovators to the customer service pros, is fully committed to our mission.

THE OPPORTUNITY: 

The Communications and Marketing Team is responsible for managing ActBlue’s communications, as well as our online and in-person presence. The Press Associate will help monitor direct press hits and wider industry coverage; promote the incredible work small-dollar donors around the country are doing, both internally and externally; and work with the rest of the team to achieve strategic teamwide goals. This position is perfect for someone passionate about politics, advocacy, and our mission of empowering small-dollar donors. 

The person in this role is expected to work Eastern Standard Time hours, due to the nature of the role in driving the day’s press work across the organization and the importance of keeping up with news from Washington, D.C..

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

  • Monitor direct and indirect press hits daily, including sending morning news clips to the entire organization (expected by 8:30 AM ET).
  • Monitor press and media trends through media monitoring/social listening platforms and distribute real time updates to relevant stakeholders
  • Work closely with our outside PR firm to respond to press requests, ensuring requests are handled by reporter deadlines.
  • Help write op-eds, press releases, and internal and external talking points.
  • Watch live and monitor congressional hearings, Supreme Court decisions, campaign launches, debates, protests, and other political or advocacy events as needed.
  • Help coordinate the release of sitewide fundraising numbers and other ActBlue-driven narratives via blog post, press release, social media, and other channels to maximize press coverage.
  • Copy edit and fact check communications with the press.
  • Assist in rapid response moments, keep an eye on incoming media requests outside of working hours, including weekends, and occasionally work early mornings, nights, and weekends as needed (sometimes on short notice based on what’s happening politically or stories that we are expecting to drop).
  • Be the first to know about new developments in online fundraising, Democratic politics, nonprofit fundraising, and campaign finance law.
  • Contribute to the ActBlue blog as needed.

WHAT YOU BRING:

  • Experience working on a campaign, with a related political organization, a PR/communications agency, or news outlet.
  • Experience writing for multiple audiences, such as members of the press, clients, and the general public.
  • Exceptional communication skills including an ability to communicate across multiple mediums with multiple stakeholders and strong writing and copy editing skills.
  • Strong judgment and discretion.
  • Ability to understand and translate complex data.
  • Interest in growing external networks.
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize multiple competing projects.
  • Incredible dedication to detail — you should sweat the small stuff.
  • Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment that can change at a moment’s notice.
  • Demonstrated commitment to diversity and inclusion in all dimensions of your work.
  • Interest in campaign finance laws and legislation and a passion for politics, organizing, and small-dollar fundraising.

LOCATION AND COMPENSATION 

This posting is for a full-time, remote, salaried position. Travel may be required on a limited basis to attend all-staff and departmental retreats (1-2 times per year). Additional travel may be required for select positions. ActBlue is currently authorized to support remote work employees in Arizona, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kentucky, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia, Washington, Washington D.C., Wisconsin and Wyoming. 

Salary Range Details:

Salary Range: $65,000-$76,500

ActBlue is committed to consistent compensation practices across our organization.  Final salary offers will take into account factors such as candidate experience, interview performance and current team salary parity. 

BENEFITS:

  • Flexible work schedules and an unlimited time-off policy
  • Fully paid and trans-inclusive health, dental, and vision insurance for employees and their families; plus fully-paid health reimbursement arrangement to use for out of pocket expenses and fully-paid short- and long-term disability 
  • Fully paid basic and AD&D life insurance and a voluntary supplemental life insurance option
  • Dependent and health care flexible spending account options
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP) benefits for employees 
  • Automatic 2% Employer-paid 401K contribution, plus up to an additional 6% match on employee contributions
  • A minimum of three months paid medical, family and parental leave (for all new parents, adoptions included)
  • Commuter or home-office benefits, including a $1,000 home-office setup allowance for all new full-time remote employees
  • Additional perks including quarterly snack deliveries and digital subscriptions to the Boston Globe & New York Times

ActBlue is unable to sponsor work visas at this time.

Bargaining Unit position: The terms and conditions of this position are subject to a collective bargaining agreement with the Campaign Workers Guild, the exclusive bargaining agent of covered ActBlue employees.

INCLUSION STATEMENT:

ActBlue is deeply committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity. We commit to retaining, developing, recruiting, and hiring a diverse staff community. We honor the dignity of all. We celebrate their unique qualities. And we recognize the wide range of human differences, backgrounds, and intersectional identities that enrich the workspace and help us better meet our mission. If you would like to request an accommodation, please contact us at recruitment@actblue.com to get started.

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Lingraphica is a mission-driven organization who provides speech-generating
devices to help improve communication, speech, and quality of life for people
with aphasia.  We look for candidates who enjoy working in a fast-paced,
goal-oriented environment, and who share our commitment to helping individuals
on their aphasia journey.


JOB DESCRIPTION

Purpose: The Software Test Engineer is responsible for ensuring that our
products meet the quality standards and are fully functional and user friendly.
This role is responsible for planning test strategy, development and execution
of test plans and test case automation for our products. The engineer is part of
a software delivery team and collaborates with the product owner in user testing
initiatives.

Our Setup

 * The team works in a two-week iteration model and follows SCRUM as the basis
   of our software development process.
 * We use Jira to track our user stories, chores, and bugs.

Duties and responsibilities

 * Plan the test strategy for applications and products
 * Develop, maintain and execute manual test plans for features and products
 * Automate and maintain sanity, feature and regression test suite.
 * Perform release/regression testing for our product updates. 
 * Identify, document and track bugs 
 * Offer deep defect root cause analysis and root cause solutions. 
 * Be able to estimate testing effort and prioritize assignments. 
 * May be required to perform other duties as assigned


QUALIFICATIONS

Skills and Competencies

 * Experience with maintaining documented test plans in a test management
   system.
 * Experience with test automation
 * Excellent written and verbal communication skills
 * Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships
   to achieve common goals.  
 * Experience with agile development methodologies such as SCRUM or Kanban is a
   plus.
 * The ability to work well independently or on a team.
 * Detail-oriented, with excellent analytical, technical and problem-solving
   skills.

Technical Skills

 * 2+ years of experience in software quality assurance including automation.
 * Experience with C# and Unity Testing Framework
 * Experience with Android on-device automated testing is a plus
 * Experience with QTest tools a plus
 * Experience with automation using Ruby, Selenium, Cucumber and Capybara
   framework will be a plus.
 * Experience with postman and API testing will be a plus.

Required Education & Certifications

 * B.S. in Computer Science or related field

Required Experience

 * 2+ years of experience testing applications


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Job Type

 * Full Time
 * 9 AM to 5 PM, Monday to Friday

Work Environment & Physical Demands 
Incumbent works from home and is expected to maintain a safe, productive work
environment with secure internet access. The ability to operate a computer with
or without a reasonable accommodation is required.    

Travel 

Travel to Lingraphica’s home office and to cities within the continental United
States for company related meetings and conferences are required two times per
year.

Accommodations  
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each
essential duty and physical demand satisfactorily. The requirements listed above
are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities and physical
demands required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals
with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  

To learn more about Lingraphica, visit: www.lingraphica.com
[http://www.lingraphica.com]!

This Organization Participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal
government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to
work in the U.S. 

Este empleador participa en E-Verify y proporcionará al gobierno federal la
información de su Formulario I-9 para confirmar que usted está autorizado para
trabajar en los EE. UU.

title: Video Infrastructure Consultant
description:
About GameChanger:

We believe in the life changing impact youth sports have on and off the field.
Sports encourage leadership, teamwork, responsibility, and confidence –
important life lessons that have the power to propel our youth toward meaningful
futures. We recognize that without coaches, parents, and volunteers, organized
youth sports could not exist. By building the first and best place to experience
the youth sports moments important to our community, we are helping families
elevate the next generation through youth sports.



So if you love sports and their community building potential, or building cool
products is your sport, GameChanger is the team for you. We are a remote first,
dynamic tech company based in New York City, and we are solving some of the
biggest challenges in youth sports today.



Job Summary

We are seeking a Video Infrastructure Consultant to guide our company in
evolving the capabilities of our video pipelines while ensuring they  will scale
with our growing user base and requirements. The ideal candidate will possess
extensive expertise in video streaming technologies, architecture, and the
ability to address our specific industry needs. They will work closely with our
team to learn, and make recommendations to architect and implement the future of
video at GC. 



What you’ll do

 * Assessment and Strategy Development - You will assess all aspects of our
   current video architecture and application requirements unique to GC users. 
   You will get to know current pain points and future aspirations.  You will
   develop a strategic roadmap with build/buy/partner decisions to best support
   our future needs. .

 * Infra Design & Scaling - You will assess our current scaling needs for video
   ingest, transcoding, storage, and client streaming.  You will get to know our
   estimated growth and make a plan to help us to grow our video capabilities
   while continuing to meet demand.

 * Security, Privacy, and Content Moderation - You will study previous and
   current challenges we’ve had to maintain a high standard to our user’s best
   interests.  You will get to know ways in which our platform has been
   misused.  You will make recommendations on how we can build our future video
   infra to increase quality outcomes for our users regarding what video they
   are exposed to on our platform.

 * Video Operations  - You will analyze and estimate how different options will
   impact cost to deliver video years into the future. You will make
   recommendations on metrics to collect to track and improve user experience
   over time. 

 * Team Formation - Based on video infra recommendations, you will give guidance
   on what type of team (size, and skills) GC will need to build and support
   that future.  



Who you are

 * A technical architect that has experience with a wide variety of video
   architectures, tools, vendors, and technologies and can speak to the relative
   trade-offs when designing and building ingest, processing, delivery, and
   storage systems and the teams to support them.

 * Strong understanding of audio and video packaging principles, codecs, and
   other associated technologies, including their relative tradeoffs, such as
   MPEG Video, MPEG-2 TS, HLS, DASH, AVC/HEVC/VP9/AV1.

 * An excellent communicator and writer capable of breaking down complex
   projects and technical details for stakeholders of varying expertise.

 * Familiar with mobile device capabilities and the challenges of optimizing
   streaming quality and reliability over cellular networks.
   

Experience

 * Multiple years of hands-on professional experience with live streaming
   workflows, preferably in a consumer and mobile environment, and exposure to a
   wide breadth of video technologies in mobile broadcast, playback, and
   back-end systems at scale.

 * Experience in live-streaming and video on demand (VoD), transcoding, storage,
   and playback back-end architectures, frameworks, and vendors (including open
   source). We use AWS but any cloud experience is a bonus.

 * Experience in client-side and server-side dynamic ad insertion architectures
   and vendors.



We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do
not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender,
sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Director of Product, Next Gen Search
description:
Upwork ($UPWK) is the world’s work marketplace. We serve everyone from one-person startups to large, Fortune 100 enterprises with a powerful, trust-driven platform that enables companies and talent to work together in new ways that unlock their potential.

Last year, more than $3.8 billion of work was done through Upwork by skilled professionals who are gaining more control by finding work they are passionate about and innovating their careers.

The Sr Director of Next Gen Search at Upwork will bring to life the future of search capabilities at Upwork, enhancing how we connect talent with opportunities and clients. By leveraging syntactic, semantic, contextual, and structural search dimensions, and incorporating voice, text, and video integrations, this role is critical to enabling transformational product experiences.. 
Collaborating closely with our multi-disciplinary teams, the ideal candidate will possess a robust technical understanding of search algorithms, rankings, and relevance, guiding us towards our mission of creating the most efficient and rewarding work marketplace.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Drive the evolution of search experiences in our marketplace, ensuring optimized user experience for both talents and hiring managers.
  • Remain at the forefront of search technology by integrating the latest advancements, including:
    • Neural-based retrieval methods for deeper contextual understanding.
    • Multimodal search capabilities, encompassing voice, text, and video search.
    • Semantic search techniques for improved relevance and comprehension.
    • AI-driven predictive search for proactive recommendation systems.
    • Real-time indexing for faster, up-to-date search results.
    • Enhanced natural language processing (NLP) for better query understanding and response.
  • Responsible for both the strategy and execution of this function, overseeing PMs, ontologists, and the expansive ontology utilized across Upwork’s platform.
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including designers, engineers, machine learning and AI scientists, analysts, ontologists, and product marketers, ensuring the successful rollout of cross-product initiatives.
  • Establish, monitor, and refine key search metrics, continuously utilizing quantitative tests to gain insights and improve search efficiency across the Upwork ecosystem.
  • Remain updated on the latest advancements in search technologies, ensuring Upwork remains at the forefront of next-gen search capabilities.
  • Mentor and nurture a team of product managers, enhancing their skills in product management and emphasizing the creation of high-performing search experiences.

What it takes to catch our eye:

  • Proven experience in leading innovative search teams and delivering state-of-the-art search and recommendation experiences.
  • Demonstrated knowledge in developing and/or leading taxonomy, ontology, or standardization initiatives.
  • Strong command over the technicalities of search, including ontology, taxonomy, and data models, to engage effectively in discussions with tech-savvy team members.
  • Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex topics clearly, align various stakeholders, and maintain a strong executive presence.
  • A proven track record of understanding customer requirements and ensuring effective collaboration across multifaceted teams.
  • An unwavering passion for Upwork’s mission and a genuine appreciation for our platform's transformative potential.

The annual base salary for this position in California and Washington ranges from $218,000 - $310,000. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum salary for this position in California and Washington, and individual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Additionally, this position is eligible for the annual bonus plan or sales incentive plan and eligibility to participate in our long term equity incentive program.

Come change how the world works.

At Upwork, you’ll shape talent solutions for how the world works today. We are a remote-first organization working together to create exciting remote work opportunities for a global community of professionals.  While we have physical offices in San Francisco and Chicago, currently we also support hiring of corporate full-time employees in 19 states in the United States. Please speak with a member of our recruitment team to determine whether you are located in a state in which we are hiring corporate full-time employees. 

Our vibrant culture is built on shared values and our mission to create economic opportunities so that people have better lives. We foster amazing teams, put our community first, and have a bias toward action. We encourage everyone to bring their whole selves to work and grow together through development opportunities, mentorship, and employee resource groups. And oh yeah, we've also got amazing benefits - including medical insurance for you and your family, unlimited PTO, 401(k) with matching, 12 weeks of paid parental leave, and a generous Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Check out our Life at Upwork page to learn more about our benefits and the employee experience.

Check out our Life at Upwork page to learn more about the employee experience.   

Upwork is proudly committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse and inclusive workforce. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Sales Account Manager – Remote
description:
LOCATION: ATLANTA,GEORGIA,UNITED STATES


SALES ACCOUNT MANAGER – REMOTE

 

Come join the exciting world of travel!

As a Sales Account Manager you could potentially earn between $80,000 – $190,000
annually (Base+commission). Consistently rated at the top of river, ocean and
expedition cruising, award winning Viking Cruises offers high earning potential
unlike any you will find.  Currently offering a Signing & Retention Bonus of
$3,000

Do you have inside, travel, insurance, real estate, mortgage, or telephone sales
experience? 

 

Viking is the place for you!!

Only applicants who live in the state of Georgia will be considered for this
opportunity.

As a remote call center sales consultant, you’ll be advising Viking guests on
cruise opportunities with the primary goal of closing the sale! 

Viking Sales Account Managers

 * Handle inbound sales calls from consumers, identify their needs, and make
   travel recommendations (no cold calling, ever)
 * Make follow-up outbound calls, overcome obstacles, and close the sale
 * Build lasting relationships to drive consumer loyalty
 * Enjoy working from home in a fully virtual environment 
 * Are resilient and have high ethical standards
 * Are coachable, open to feedback, highly motivated and driven to succeed with
   an entrepreneurial spirit
 * Are highly collaborative and a self-starter

 To be considered for a career with Viking, you will need:

 * 2 years’ experience in remote telephone sales with a verifiable track record
   of success
 *  Call center experience, preferred
 * Ability to maintain individual sales goals 
 *  Previous sales experience with ability to close on the first call
 *  Flexibility in your schedule, to include evenings, weekends, and holidays
 * Proficiency with basic computer applications and equipment (MS Word, Teams,
   Outlook)
 * Must be able to provide:
   *     A distraction-free workspace/environment
   *    Space for a desktop computer with 2-3 monitors
   *    Stable power source and internet connection:
     * Dedicated high-speed internet (minimum) of 25 Mbps Upload and Download
       Speeds and ethernet connection (connection cannot be Wireless, Wi-Fi
       extenders, Wi-Fi repeaters, MiFi's, or Hotspots)

What we offer you:

 * Commission Guarantee: two thousand dollars per month for the first 3 months
   of employment
 * Highly competitive compensation plan 
   * Pay Range: twenty-nine thousand to thirty-eight thousand nine hundred
     dollars annually/paid hourly (determined by several factors, such as
     geographic location)
   * Historic average commission range: fifty-three thousand dollars -one
     hundred fifty-two thousand dollars (based on overall department performance
     and the terms of the applicable commission plan
 * Annual Discretionary Bonus
 * Full benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability
   insurance at a highly subsidized rate (some plans are fully paid by Viking)
 * 401(k) plan with company match
 * Vacation accrues up to 15 days per year
 * Paid sick time
 * Paid training
 * Paid holiday
 * Free and/or discounted cruises
 * Highly subsidized gym membership
 * Discounts on theatres, theme parks, movie tickets, and much more
    

About Viking

Viking was founded in 1997 with the vision that travel could be more destination
focused and culturally immersive. In 2000, the company purchased Europe’s KD
River Cruises in order to grow its fleet, to leverage 40 years of river cruising
experience and to acquire rights to prime docking locations in key European
cities.

The company expanded into the American market in 2000, establishing a sales and
marketing office in Los Angeles, California. Since then, Viking has grown to be
the leading small ship travel company, offering river, ocean and expedition
voyages on all seven continents.

With an operational office in Basel, Switzerland, Viking provides
destination-focused itineraries for curious travelers. Each journey includes a
shore excursion in every port and an onboard and onshore enrichment program that
provides deep immersion in the destination through performances of music and
art, cooking demonstrations, informative port talks and carefully selected guest
lecturers.

With 250 awards to its name, the company currently operates a fleet of
state-of-the-art ships that have received numerous accolades since their launch
from industry experts and travelers alike. For the second year in a row, Viking
was voted the #1 River Line and the #1 Ocean Line by Condé Nast Traveler in the
publication’s 2022 Readers’ Choice Awards. Viking was also named #1 for both
Rivers and Oceans by Travel + Leisure in the 2022 World’s Best Awards making it
the only cruise line to reach the top of its categories in both publications in
the same year.

 

Viking marked its 25th anniversary in 2022; during this milestone year, Viking
welcomed two new identical expedition ships, as well as two new, identical ocean
ships, new Viking Longships® in Europe and new purpose-built vessels for the
Nile, Mekong and Mississippi rivers.

 


 


#LI-AH1

#LI-Remote

Apply to this job
[https://vikingcruises.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0v6ra/?apply=true]

title: Solutions Architect - App Innovation
description:
Are you looking for a role that motivates and challenges you? Are you ready for an opportunity for growth? Do you want to work on teams where people roll up their sleeves to take on tough problems together, and regularly blow the doors off our clients with their outstanding teamwork? If you answered yes to those questions, 3Cloud might just be for you!

At 3Cloud, we hire people who aren’t afraid to experiment or fail. We hire people who are willing to give direct and candid feedback to their managers, leaders, and team members. We hire people who jump at those opportunities because they care about our collective growth and success. We hire people who challenge and hold each other accountable for living 3Cloud’s core values because they know that it will result in amazing experiences and solutions for our clients and each other.

Position Overview: As a Solutions Architect for App Innovation at 3Cloud, you will be at the forefront of our mission to deliver cutting-edge solutions on the Azure platform. Your technical expertise, coupled with a strong understanding of our clients’ business needs, will be instrumental in driving innovative solutions and ensuring client satisfaction. You will closely collaborate with the sales teams to explore, design, and deliver solutions, thereby significantly contributing to our growth in the Azure ecosystem.

Responsibilities:

  1. Client Engagement:
    • Develop and nurture strong relationships with key client stakeholders, serving as a trusted advisor throughout their Azure-based technology transformation and App Innovation journey.
    • Engage with customers, both onsite and remotely, by providing technical expertise during the sales process.
  2. Sales Support:
    • Provide expertise to the sales team, supporting them in pursuing and closing engagements related to App Innovation and Azure-based solutions.
    • Collaborate with sales executives on strategy, pursuit, and closure of key opportunities, aiming to expand revenue influence and client satisfaction.
  3. Solution Development:
    • Collaborating with sales teams to ensure effective sales strategies and alignment with client needs.
    • Lead the creation of reference architectures, documentation, and intellectual property that ensures secure, scalable, and profitable service delivery.
  4. Development & Thought Leadership:
    • Build and deliver high-value and reusable enablement content that measurably improves the team’s effectiveness and execution.
    • Continuously improve your professional skills with a focus on personal mastery and team learning through activities such as training, reading, and seeking mentorship from others.
  5. Collaboration and Teamwork:
    • Work cross-departmentally to find solutions to complex scenarios and integration issues.
    • Participate in team mentorship and knowledge sharing, fostering a culture of growth and innovation.
  6. Service Line / Service Delivery Framework Development:
    • Contribute to the ideation and development of internal and external solutions that support business initiatives and cross-practice opportunities.
    • Drive the creation of accelerators, intellectual property, and innovative solutions that enhance services offerings.

Requirements:

  • Expertise in cloud platforms, particularly Microsoft Azure, and familiarity with AWS and GCP is advantageous.
  • Proven experience in pre-sales and sales support within a professional services organization, with a track record of successfully pursuing and closing engagements.
  • Technical presentation and communication skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong ability to provide constructive feedback and guidance to team members.
  • Passion for enhancing client experiences and achieving business goals using cloud solutions.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset with a proactive approach to identifying and capitalizing on opportunities for improvement.
  • Detail-oriented with a commitment to delivering excellence and accuracy.
  • Microsoft Azure certification, such as Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert, is a plus.
  • Ability to travel if needed and comply with the company’s travel policy
  • Strong background in App Innovation and solution development, with exposure to a wide range of cloud/Azure solutions.
  • Experience with modern software development and their associated technologies
  • Proficiency in designing and developing cloud applications to meet client needs.
  • Understanding of the end-to-end software development lifecycle
  • Experience with cloud computing and related technologies and practices
  • Understanding of continuous integration and continuous deployment

At 3Cloud, we value Client Success, Growth, and Winning Together. If you're ready to be part of a dedicated team pushing the boundaries of what's possible with Azure, we'd love to hear from you!

 

3Cloud Total Rewards Highlights Include:  

  • Flexible work location with a virtual first approach to work! 
  • 401(K) with match up to 50% of your 6% contributions of eligible pay 
  • Generous PTO providing a minimum of 15 days in addition to 9 paid company holidays and 2 floating personal days  
  • Three medical plan options to allow you the choice to elect what works best for you! 
  • Option for vision and dental coverage 
  • 100% employer premium coverage for STD and LTD 
  • Paid leave for birth parents and non-birth parents 
  • Option for FSA, HSA, HRA and Dependent Care 
  • $67.00 monthly tech and home office allowance
  • Utilization and/or discretionary bonus eligibility based on role 
  • Robust Employee Assistance Program to help with everyday challenges 
3Cloud offers competitive compensation. In addition to base pay employees are eligible to receive an annual discretionary/utilization bonus. If you are hired at 3Cloud your final base salary is based on factors such as skills, education, experience and/or geographic location. Please keep in mind that the range mentioned above includes the full base salary range for the role. It is not typical for offers to be made at or near the top of the range.
Base Salary Range
$169,000—$203,000 USD

Don’t meet every single requirement? At 3Cloud we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway.

At this time, we cannot sponsor applicants for work visas.

title: Product/Data Research Associate (Public Sector)
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Publicis Sapient is a digital transformation partner helping established
organizations get to their future, digitally-enabled state, both in the way they
work and the way they serve their customers.We help unlock value through a
start-up mindset and modern methods, fusing strategy, consulting and customer
experience with agile engineering and problem-solving creativity.United by our
core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of
next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience
across truly value


JOB DESCRIPTION

A a Product/Data Research Associate, you will work in the data management team
to support various projects such as data ingestion and quality verification of
clinical datasets, performing data analysis using data science tools &
techniques, etc.
Qualified applicants must be detail-oriented, result-driven individuals who work
well within team environments and have good interpersonal skills, as well as
good client interaction skills.

Your impact:

 * Assist researchers to integrate data files into a web based data management
   system
 * Work closely with researchers to assist with data mapping and data
   submission; perform ad hoc data entry; and QA submitted datasets.
   * Collaborate in development of new data collection forms
   * Detect problems in data collection forms and data submissions
 * Deliver helpdesk support, providing technical guidance to a wide end user
   audience;
   * Provides training on use of the data management system (including updates
     and changes)
   * Plans and directs computer-aided instructional sessions and workshops
 * Update data management system documentation
 * Collaborate with the IT team in testing and maintaining the data management
   system


QUALIFICATIONS

 * Must be a U.S. Citizen or U.S. Legal Permanent Resident
 * Eligible for U.S. Government Clearance
 * 2-4 years of relevant work experience, preferable in a related field: life
   sciences, health programs, clinical research, NIH, or other related
   government/health research programs
 * Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) Excel,
   expertise preferred
 * Excellent analytical, organizational and time management skills with the
   ability to adapt to a dynamic project environment
 * Ability to communicate effectively (verbally and in writing)
 * Strong skills in organizing and tracking data and performing analyses
 * Experience with providing analysis and support to science and technology
   programs
 * Experience working with interpreted programming languages (Python, R, and/or
   Shell Scripting) 
 * Familiarity with Agile project management methodologies and JIRA
 * Familiarity with large language models
 * Ability to adapt and flex in a collaborative multidisciplinary environment
 * Bachelor’s Degree (preferred: scientific discipline accompanied with basic
   understanding of the clinical development and data management processes)


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

 * Gender-Neutral Policy
 * Access to Prepaid Medical Plan
 * Employee engagement activities and events

As part of our dedication to an inclusive and diverse workforce, Publicis
Sapient is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race,
color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability,
sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to
providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities
and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance
or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at
hiring@publicis.sapient.com [hiring@publicis.sapient.com] or you may call us at
+1-617-621-0200.

Pay Range:

Annual Pay Range: 76,000 - 113,000 USD

The range shown represents a grouping of relevant ranges currently in use at
