title: Staff Product Manager, Data API
description:
Reddit is a community of communities where people can dive into anything through experiences built around their interests, hobbies, and passions. Our mission is to bring community, belonging, and empowerment to everyone in the world. Reddit users submit, vote, and comment on content, stories, and discussions about the topics they care about the most. From pets to parenting, there’s a community for everybody on Reddit and with over 50 million daily active users, it is home to the most open and authentic conversations on the internet. For more information, visit redditinc.com.

The Team: 

Reddit has an amazing history of individual and community-driven innovation. With no official support, thousands of user scripts, self-identified bots and services run against our API and enrich the experience Redditors have on our platform. Furthermore, the value of Reddit data has powered the creation and growth of numerous businesses. The goal of the Reddit Developer Platform team is to further empower communities to innovate while establishing a significant new business centered on our Data API.

We are looking for an experienced Staff Product Manager with a strong technical background to lead our Data API. You will play a pivotal role in not only evolving the existing Data API, but also spearheading initiatives to monetize API products effectively. This is a unique opportunity to join a key pillar of one of the most important consumer products on the Internet.

Responsibilities: 

  • Develop a product strategy for our API product suite, setting vision, goals and roadmaps
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Engineering, UX/UI Design, Marketing, and Customer Support to deliver high-quality API products
  • Conduct market research to identify user needs, trends, and competitive opportunities to enhance API offerings
  • Develop comprehensive product requirements and documentation to drive API development
  • Prioritize and manage development backlogs, ensuring timelines and deliverables are met
  • Measure and analyze API performance, usage, and adoption, and drive continuous improvement based on findings
  • Act as a product evangelist, fostering relationships with the developer community and promoting API products
  • Drive the creation of developer resources, such as documentation, tutorials, and sample code
  • Identify and exploit revenue generation opportunities through innovative API product development and enhancement initiatives

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field.
  • Minimum of 5+ years of experience as a Product Manager, ideally for developer-facing products.
  • Coding experience, with proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g. Python, TypeScript, JavaScript).
  • Strong understanding of API design, development, and lifecycle.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Clear passion for Reddit and it’s mission
  • Proven experience in managing and delivering API products
  • Experience using Reddit’s APIs
  • MBA or advanced degree in a relevant field.

Benefits:

  • Comprehensive Health benefits
  • 401k Matching
  • Workspace benefits for your home office
  • Personal & Professional development funds
  • Family Planning Support
  • Flexible Vacation (please use them!) & Reddit Global Days Off
  • 4+ months paid Parental Leave
  • Paid Volunteer time off

 

#LI-AS5

Pay Transparency:

This job posting may span more than one career level.

In addition to base salary, this job is eligible to receive equity in the form of restricted stock units, and depending on the position offered, it may also be eligible to receive a commission. Additionally, Reddit offers a wide range of benefits to U.S.-based employees, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) program with employer match, generous time off for vacation, and parental leave. To learn more, please visit https://www.redditinc.com/careers/.

To provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base pay ranges for all US-based job postings regardless of state. We set standard base pay ranges for all roles based on function, level, and country location, benchmarked against similar stage growth companies. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including, skills, depth of work experience and relevant licenses/credentials, and may vary from the amounts listed below.

The base pay range for this position is:
$198,200—$297,300 USD

Reddit is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at ApplicationAssistance@Reddit.com.

title: Sr. Technical Sales Enablement Program Manager
description:
The GitLab DevSecOps platform empowers 100,000+ organizations to deliver software faster and more efficiently. We are one of the world’s largest all-remote companies with 2,000+ team members and values that foster a culture where people embrace the belief that everyone can contribute. Learn more about Life at GitLab.

Remote, Western Europe

An overview of this role

As an individual contributor reporting to the Sr Director of Global Field Enablement, you will build and deploy product enablement programs and training curricula to help our customer-facing field teams build a deeper technical understanding of our product use cases, effectively demonstrate and clearly differentiate our platform capabilities, and successfully articulate the power of GitLab’s AI-Powered DevSecOps platform. 

In this role, you will partner with Technical Marketing, Product Marketing and Management, Solutions Architecture & Field CTO, Customer Success, Customer Education, and various other field team members to build quantitatively measurable product enablement for our customer-facing teams. 

If you are a builder, if you enjoy working with technical go-to-market teams, and if experiential lab-based training and scenario-based enablement sounds exciting, then you should apply.   

What you’ll do  

  • Build and define technical sales capability models and product knowledge skills matrices for multiple roles (Account Executives, Customer Success Managers, Solution Architects, and Professional Services)
  • Build, deploy, maintain, and report on blended learning solutions and pathways by role (digital self-service, experiential/labs, instructor-led workshops, assessments, and technical accreditations).
  • Run bi-annual (2x per year) self and manager skills assessments mapped to the skills matrices and report on the continuous progress improvements and opportunities or skill gaps.
  • Create and manage a repository of consumable product training, demo videos, labs and workshops, and other resources for digital self-service consumption. 
  • Collaborate regularly with Customer Success, Solutions Architecture, Technical Marketing, and Customer Education teams to align on product enablement plans and learning paths.
  • Analyze and report on the success of all product enablement programs and training, including business outcomes like use case adoption, effective proof of value and trial execution, pipeline generation, product competitive differentiation and customer messaging (at scale), and efficient pipeline stage progression.
  • Build manager coaching resources and accreditations for scaled on-the-job reinforcement and sustainment.
  • Maintain in-depth knowledge of the entire GitLab application and use cases.

What you’ll bring 

  • 7+ years experience building product enablement programs and curricula for B2B enterprise sales and/or experience in a technical software sales or a technical sales enablement role, solutions engineering or architecture teams, preferably with expertise in DevOps and/or Open Source software 
  • Introductory knowledge and subject matter familiarity with modern software development and their associated technologies
  • Knowledge of the end-to-end software development lifecycle, security and governance, and continuous integration and continuous deployment, is a plus
  • Ability to use GitLab and willing to work with Git and GitLab whenever possible
  • Experience writing technical documentation and building experiential learning programs using virtual lab environments
  • Strong technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills
  • Self-manages workload to meet deadlines and prioritize accordingly
  • Strong collaboration skills and ability to gather feedback and build consensus with multiple stakeholders
  • Detailed oriented and analytical

About the team

The GitLab Field Enablement team exists to inspire our field and partners to achieve high levels of success through the acquisition and application of knowledge, skills and behaviors - at scale - that improve productivity and accelerate customer outcomes & growth. We have a lot of fun doing this!

Thanks to our Transparency value, you can learn more about our Field Enablement strategy and programs on our Field Enablement Team Handbook page. 

How GitLab will support you

  • Benefits to support your health, finances, and well-being
  • All remote, asynchronous work environment
  • Flexible Paid Time Off
  • Team Member Resource Groups
  • Equity Compensation & Employee Stock Purchase Plan
  • Growth and development budget 
  • Parental leave 
  • Home office support

Please note that we welcome interest from candidates with varying levels of experience; many successful candidates do not meet every single requirement. Additionally, studies have shown that people from underrepresented groups are less likely to apply to a job unless they meet every single qualification. If you're excited about this role, please apply and allow our recruiters to assess your application.

Country Hiring Guidelines: GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.  

Privacy Policy: Please review our Recruitment Privacy Policy. Your privacy is important to us.

GitLab is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. GitLab’s policies and practices relating to recruitment, employment, career development and advancement, promotion, and retirement are based solely on merit, regardless of race, color, religion, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, lactation, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression), national origin, age, citizenship, marital status, mental or physical disability, genetic information (including family medical history), discharge status from the military, protected veteran status (which includes disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, active duty wartime or campaign badge veterans, and Armed Forces service medal veterans), or any other basis protected by law. GitLab will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. See also GitLab’s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know during the recruiting process.

title: SQL Server Database Administrator
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Locus Robotics is a leader in the rapidly growing eCommerce order fulfillment
optimization space. Our solution helps warehouse owners attain 2-3X efficiency
improvement over cart-picking operations, by empowering pickers to work
collaboratively with our robots. All this is accomplished while integrating with
the operator’s Warehouse Management System, utilizing and optimizing existing
facility infrastructure.


JOB DESCRIPTION

We are seeking an experienced SQL Server Database Administrator who has a
successful track record setting up, maintaining, and supporting multiple SQL
Server databases in a high availability, high transaction environment.  The role
will also include ensuring top performance for these systems and troubleshooting
customer issues.  You will also have the opportunity to make product development
contributions working with a strong, seasoned Software Development team.

This role is open to working remotely in the US, Canada, or EMEA. 

Responsibilities:

 * Ensure high availability and backup of production databases.
 * Installation, provisioning, and configuration of new databases.
 * Performance diagnosis and tuning.
 * Provide support for issue diagnosis and problem resolution.
 * Be the subject matter expert on database development and tuning best
   practices.


QUALIFICATIONS

 * 5+ Years of SQL Server Database Administration.
 * Strong proficiency in Microsoft SQL Server, SQL Server Replication,
   Transact-SQL, and other related tools.
 * Strong proficiency in performance monitoring, troubleshooting, and tuning.
 * Strong knowledge of high availability and disaster recovery concepts for high
   transaction systems.
 * Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server, hardware platforms, storage
   systems, networking concepts, virtualization, etc.
 * Experience with database monitoring tools.
 * Experience with using SQL Server on Amazon or Azure
 * Familiar with software versioning / source control tools.
 * Familiar with collaboration tools (JIRA, Confluence, Slack, etc).
 * Good written and verbal communication skills, both with team members and
   product stakeholders.
 * Strong time management skills.
 * Bachelor’s Degree and/or relevant certifications.
 * Experience in Warehouse Fulfillment and/or Robotics industry a plus.


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Locus Robotics is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Manager, GTM Field Enablement
description:
See yourself at Twilio

Join the team as Twilio’s next Manager, GTM Field Enablement 

Who we are & why we’re hiring

Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer experiences.

Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we have presence throughout South America, Europe, Asia and Australia. We're on a journey to becoming a global company that actively opposes racism and all forms of oppression and bias. At Twilio, we support diversity, equity & inclusion wherever we do business.

About the job

This person in this position will report directly to the Head of GTM Enablement working closely with their peers in the GTM Enablement organization as we continue to transform the business and state of Enablement. If you like adding value and seeing the direct impact of your work while thriving in highly dynamic environments and love rolling your sleeves up to get things done, this role is for you. This is a people leader role. 

Responsibilities

In this role, you’ll:

  • Partner with the Head of GTM Enablement to develop quarterly enablement plans and lead the Field Enablement Business Partners to execute the plans
  • Execute on a plan to establish and conduct Leadership Development programs
  • Customize and deliver content tailored by audience leveraging cutting edge enablement tools 
  • Help coach sellers to ensure skills are mastered   
  • Experience working independently and as part of a team, specifically coming with experience developing strong cross functional relationships
  • Provide thought leadership to the organization through contributions to knowledge bases, training sessions, knowledge development, weekly updates 
  • Maintain knowledge of Twilio’s competitor’s products, company direction, financial stability, etc  
  • Lead and develop team of GTM Field Enablement Business Partners

Qualifications 

Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly. Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having “desired” qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the table!

Required:

  • 8+ years of experience in Enterprise B2B Enablement or training in a high-tech environment. Prior sales experience is a plus
  • Prior experience leveraging enablement best practices, sales processes, sales coaching and sales methodologies.  
  • Training delivery and facilitation skills with experience delivering virtual instructor led sessions. 
  • Knowledge of LMS systems, enablement tools such as Gong, Highspot or other content management systems. 
  • Capable of leveraging adult learning theory to develop enablement programs, content and assets that enable just-in-time, on-demand learnings with measurable outcomes tied to business objectives
  • Experience delivering leadership development programs having certifications in coaching, leadership development programs and/or sales methodologies 
  • Experience delivering leadership development programs having certifications in coaching, leadership development programs and/or sales methodologies 

Desired:

  • Prior leadership experience though we are open to a first time leader

Location

This role will be remote but is not eligible to be hired in San Francisco, CA, Oakland, CA, San Jose, CA, or the surrounding areas.

Other Notes

*Please note this role is open to candidates outside of Colorado, California, New York, and Washington. The information below is provided for candidates hired in those locations only.

The estimated pay ranges for this role are as follows:

  • Based in Colorado: $120,160 - $150,200.
  • Based in New York, Washington State, or California (outside of the San Francisco Bay area): $127,280 - $159,100.
  • Based in the San Francisco Bay area, California: $141,360 - $176,700.
  • This role may be eligible to participate in Twilio’s equity plan. All roles are eligible for the following benefits: health care insurance, 401(k) retirement account, paid sick time, paid personal time off, paid parental leave.

The successful candidate’s starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location within the state.

What We Offer

There are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary by location.

Twilio thinks big. Do you?

We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody our values — something we call Twilio Magic. Additionally, we empower employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their volunteering and donation efforts.  So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be the best version of yourself, apply now! If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open positions.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Twilio is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Additionally, Twilio participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.

Twilio is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommodation@twilio.com.

title: Senior Channel Sales Operations Manager
description:
About Us

With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world’s leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.

Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.

At ChargePoint, we foster a positive and productive work environment by committing to live our values of Be Courageous, Charge Together, Love our Customers, Operate with Openness, and Relentlessly Pursue Awesome. These values guide how we show up every day, align, and work together to build a brighter future for all of us.

Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.

Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.

Senior Channel Sales Operations Manager

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced data-driven Senior Channel Sales Operations Manager to join our dynamic team. The primary responsibility of this role is to leverage data and analytics to optimize our channel sales forecasting processes. You will be responsible for providing strategic insights, making data-backed recommendations, and streamlining processes related to the bookings and billings forecast. The Channel Sales Operations Manager should be proactive, data-savvy, and possess excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills to drive results in a dynamic sales environment, especially when working alongside various partners in the channel ecosystem. This critical role will play a key part in enhancing our channel sales forecasting efficiency and overall performance.

Reporting to

Sr. Director, Sales Operations

Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze historical sales, distributor inventory, and sell-through data to discern patterns, identify opportunities, and address challenges.
  • Develop data models and algorithms to support accurate billings forecasts and provide stocking order recommendations.
  • Manage large datasets from internal systems and external channel partners and perform regular data quality and data integrity audits.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create accurate and actionable billings forecasts.
  • Oversee channel order shipments and returns, price adjustments and make data-informed recommendations to refine existing processes ensuring efficiency.
  • Streamline channel sales processes by identifying bottlenecks and proposing improvements.
  • Recommend adjustments to sales strategies based on data-driven insights to maximize sell-through rates.
  • Collaborate with channel partners on requirements for data collection.
  • Maintain open channels of communication with key stakeholders, including resellers, distributors, and strategic partners, ensuring alignment, and understanding across the board.
  • Develop and maintain comprehensive weekly and quarterly reports and dashboards that provide a comprehensive view of channel sales performance, including pipeline management, billings, sell-through, linearity reporting and other vital KPI reporting.
  • Articulate insights and actionable recommendations to senior management, ensuring clarity and fostering data-driven decision-making.
  • Work in collaboration with resellers, distributors, and strategic partners to ensure systems and processes are aligned for scalability.
  • Foster strong relationships with these partners to drive mutual growth and streamline operations.

 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, or a related field.
  • Proven experience in channel sales operations, forecasting and data analysis.
  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, data visualization tools).
  • Ability to manage through ambiguity and develop solutions.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data.
  • Detail-oriented with a strategic mindset.

Location

Arizona, Remote

ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. 

The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $92,250 to $179,250. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location. 

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

If there is a match between your experiences/skills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.

ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. 
Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
About Us

With electric vehicles expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint (NYSE: CHPT) is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world’s leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need across North America and Europe. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.

Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on making the transition to electric easy for businesses, fleets and drivers. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to create an all-electric future and a trillion-dollar market.

At ChargePoint, we foster a positive and productive work environment by committing to live our values of Be Courageous, Charge Together, Love our Customers, Operate with Openness, and Relentlessly Pursue Awesome. These values guide how we show up every day, align, and work together to build a brighter future for all of us.

Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.

Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.

Position Summary

On the ChargePoint Inside Sales team, sales cycles are born, as well as sales careers.  As the first line of communication with prospects, Sales Development Representatives (SDR) have a strong understanding of the sales process, excel at researching leads, starting new relationships, and setting our North America Sales team up for success.  You will use phone, email, social media, and other cutting-edge sales tools to innovatively engage with prospective buyers, identify active buying interest and create qualified sales opportunities. 

You’ll have the chance to work on a highly competitive and collaborative team, learn from senior leadership and master your sales skills in a fast-paced environment that fosters continuous learning and professional growth.  SDRs who establish high performance will have an opportunity for new challenges and career advancement within inside sales and the potential for future roles in outside sales, channel, marketing, and customer success with a hyper-growth company. 

What you will do

  • Utilize Salesforce and other best in class sales tools, cold calling, live chat, and email to generate new qualified sales opportunities.
  • Identify prospect’s needs and suggest appropriate products/services.
  • Build trusting relationships with prospects to qualify leads as sales opportunities.
  • Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market.
  • Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) customers, sales executives, and channel partners.
  • Report to sales manager with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results.

What you will bring

  • You are located in the Phoenix metropolitan area.
  • Previous sales experience is preferred but not required. Those interested in a career in sales should apply.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • High degree of resiliency, enabling you to bounce back from setbacks.
  • Player mindset: you strive to compete, grow, develop, and never back down from a challenge.
  • Unmatched work ethic: anything you don’t know you will make up with hard work.
  • You are highly coachable and willing to receive and implement feedback.
  • Desire to grow beyond current role, regardless of function.
  • A passion for disrupting the traditional automotive industry by helping promote the EV industry.
  • Minimal travel is expected for this role (less than four trips per year).

Education

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required.

Location

US, Remote

ChargePoint is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. 

The targeted US salary range for roles at this operating level is $40,500 to $56,500. This range represents base salary and does not reflect equity, benefits or variable pay where applicable. Actual base salaries are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, experience, certifications and specific work location. 

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.

If there is a match between your experiences/skills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.

ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. 
Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.

title: Senior Privacy Engineer/Architect
description:
COMPANY DESCRIPTION

The Linux Foundation is the organization of choice for the world’s top
developers and companies to build ecosystems that accelerate open technology
development and commercial adoption. Together with the worldwide open source
community, it is solving the hardest technology problems by creating the largest
shared technology investment in history.

Today, the Linux Foundation has over 2,000 corporate members from over 41
countries, including every single one the Fortune 100. The Linux Foundation has
proudly created over $54B in shared technology value since inception. We’re
growing at a phenomenal rate and we’re looking for top privacy engineer to join
our growing engineering team


JOB DESCRIPTION

The Privacy Engineer/Architect is a project contributor and liaison with
expertise in technical dimensions of data privacy and protection. They will work
closely with the Data Protection Office, data producers and analysts, product
managers, and software engineers to implement privacy enhancing technologies
tools, and incorporate privacy by design/default principles into various
solutions.

Essential Skills:

 * Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

 * Excellent communication skills (verbal and written), and ability to convince
   stakeholders.

 * Ability to balance risks in ambiguous and complex situations.

 * Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration skills in leading or contributing to
   global and multi-functional teams.

 * Highly motivated to contribute and grow within a complex area of emerging
   importance.

 * Experience in supporting the alignment of governance materials, policies, and
   procedures.

 * Strong written, analytical, and oral communication skills with a keen
   attention to detail.

Tasks and Responsibilities:

 * Develop and implement solutions to ensure privacy policies are correctly
   implemented. The implementations should advance compliance with legal forms
   of data use as well as support business use of data.
 * Work to align advanced technologies and Privacy by Design principles from the
   first stages of development and ensure that the data used meets established
   regulatory compliance needs. 
 * Collaborate with data product development teams, creating new data uses that
   employ privacy features.
 * Interacting with internal privacy program managers, product development
   teams, and legal, compliance, governance, and data protection teams. 
 * Analyze, design and program software enhancements for new data streams to
   develop technical solutions and systems to help mitigate privacy
   vulnerabilities and prevent potential future privacy risks.
 * Responsible for assisting with the management of the data privacy, data
   protection, data usability, performance, and the integrity of the privacy
   solution.
 * Using current programming language and technologies, creates a solid design,
   writes code, completes programming, and performs testing and debugging of
   applications, as well as completes documentation and procedures for
   installation and maintenance.
   * Using current programming language and technologies such as Java,
     JavaScript, Python, and HTML, creates solid design, writes code, completes
     programming, and performs testing and debugging of applications as well as
     completes documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance
 * Prepares and maintains (or ensures maintenance of) data protection program
   documentation, including personal data records of processing, Data Protection
   Impact Assessments (DPIAs), and data incident record,s and conducts periodic
   compliance assessments of these.
 * Interact with users to define system requirements and/or necessary
   modifications to new or existing software. 
 * Assists in the development and maintenance of policies, standards, playbooks
   and standard operating procedures that support global privacy and data
   protection program objectives.
 * Interface with other developers and architects in implementing big data
   solutions that enable the business to be data driven while protecting the
   data assets. 
 * Interface with the usability team to ensure user-facing privacy controls are
   usable.
 * Use data anonymization, pseudonymization and encryption to develop systems
   that preserve and improve privacy protections.
 * Guide the development of new privacy products and features.
 * Identify areas of improvement in local practices relative to managing data
   privacy.
 * Performs regular privacy assessments of operational processes, identifying
   and mitigating risks across the company through effective tools, training,
   and guidance
 * Communicate program progress, escalations, and issue analysis to key
   stakeholders
 * Acts as key interface to data science and analytics communities both within
   and outside of the organization

Knowledge and Skills:

 * Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
 * Excellent communication skills (verbal and written), ability to influence
   without authority.
 * Ability to balance risks in ambiguous and complex situations.
 * Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration skills, particularly in leading or
   contributing to global and multi-functional teams.
 * Highly motivated to contribute and grow within a complex area of emerging
   importance.
 * Experience or understanding of software applications, design tools and
   languages
 * Understanding of design for software applications running on multiple
   platforms.
 * Understanding of testing, coding and debugging procedures.
 * Demonstrated working knowledge of software engineering fundamentals.
 * Competent in the interpretation of numeric data, an understanding of
   statistical principles.
 * Data literacy: finding and managing data, cleansing data, manipulating data.
 * Ability to perform operations on large datasets


QUALIFICATIONS

 

 * Bachelor’s degree in either computer science, computer engineering,
   information systems, privacy engineering or equivalent experience; an
   advanced degree or CISSP, CISM or CIPT certification is a plus.

 * Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience working with multiple facets of a
   global corporate privacy program, at least 2 years of which with a high
   degree of independence.

 * Working knowledge of key global privacy legislation, including but not
   limited to GDPR and CCPA/CPRA.

 * CIPT certification

 * Strong software development skills. 

 * Experience and comfort in preparing and leading presentations and discussions
   in a business setting.

 * Experience with report/technical writing and management, capable of
   conducting data privacy compliance reviews and audits.

Perks

 * Competitive salary
 * Outstanding health benefits
 * Unlimited PTO
 * 100% 401k match (up to the IRS-defined limit per year).
 * Travel around the world
 * Work with a respected, high-performing team that works collaboratively and
   supports each other.
 * Work from home, forever!
 * ‘Flex Fridays’
 * And more!


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

The Linux Foundation is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Revenue Operations Analyst
description:
About Wurl, LLC.

Wurl is a global streaming network. Our B2B services provide streamers, content companies, and advertisers with a powerful, integrated network to distribute and monetize streaming television reaching hundreds of million of connected televisions in over 50 countries.  In 2022 Wurl was acquired by AppLovin (Nasdaq: APP), an industry-leading mobile marketing ad tech company, bringing together the technology and innovation of the mobile and television industries.  With the merger, Wurl employees enjoy the best of both worlds: the dynamic environment of a 150+ person start-up and the stability of a high-growth public tech company.  

 

Wurl is a fully-remote company that has been recognized for a second year in a row as a Great Place to Work.  Wurl invests in providing a culture that fosters passion, drives excellence, and encourages collaboration to drive innovation. We hire the world’s best to build a bunch of cool stuff on an interface fully integrated with their own from streaming, advertising and software technology to continue to help us disrupt the way the world watches television. 

 

Revenue Operations Analyst (Remote): 

The Business Operations team at Wurl is looking for a Revenue Ops Analyst to join as a key driver of sales enablement and time-to-revenue. The right candidate will work hands on with the sales team to streamline processes, organize the pipeline, manage reporting and analytics, while also managing training for new products and services. This role will be a critical part of the Business Ops team, making sure that management and executive leadership have clear visibility into revenue and performance. This individual will thrive with cross-team collaboration to ensure key departments (such as legal, accounting and marketing) are in sync. The Revenue Ops Analyst will also spearhead any and all efforts to automate workflows and find efficiencies, which may include implementing processes and/or integrating software for the Business Ops and wider Sales team. The ideal candidate will have a broad knowledge of sales enablement practices and analytics, have cross-team problem-solving experience and a solid past in driving revenue growth.

 

What You'll Do: 

  • Work with Sales, Finance and Business Operations leadership to establish robust rules of engagement to govern sales processes and eliminate friction between the sales and engineering/product organizations
  • Partner closely with sales  leadership to implement scalable, repeatable, data-driven processes
  • Facilitate successful implementation and adoption of new processes within the sales organization
  • Collaborate across the sales, legal and finance teams to ensure customer deal desk agreements translate to sales orders and other customer agreements
  • Collaborate across engineering and product to assist sales with RFPs and new business inquiries that require further technical support
  • Assist sales enablement with the focus on compressing new hire ramp time, improving overall sales productivity, and ensuring sales process consistency and efficiency
  • Facilitate training sessions for existing staff regarding new product releases and updates to current services
  • Partner with internal data teams to ensure data accuracy in Salesforce. This will include but is not limited to managing cross-functional teams to establish consistent definitions to process and interdepartmental information collection and sharing
  • Partner with members of the Business Operations team to develop dashboards and reports leveraging existing technologies such as Hubspot and Groove to ensure forecasting and reporting efforts are appropriately integrated within the company

 

 Who You Are:

  • BA/BS degree (Computer Science, Finance and /or Economics degrees are preferred)
  • 2+ years experience in a Revenue, Sales, Finance or Business Operations role 
  • A proven track record in improving workflows and optimizing processes - particularly by utilizing automation to improve sales team functions 
  • Experience running all aspects of sales enablement including (but not limited to) pipeline growth, leads management and internal sales training
  • Must be a proven leader who is able to collaborate and communicate well with employees of all levels - from individual contributors to the executive-level.
  • Expert communicator both internally and externally with customers and represent the company effectively
  • Collaborative, strategic, roll up your sleeves/hands-on results oriented leader and team player who thrives on helping others meet their goals
  • Ability to interpret and communicate data effectively with strong analytical skills. Must be well versed in Salesforce as well as Google Sheets, Excel and similar programs

Please provide a cover letter highlighting your leadership and  analytical skills, along with examples of automated processes you have successfully implemented and how you ensured adoption by the wider team.

 

What We Offer

  • Competitive Salary
  • Strong Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits, 90% paid by Wurl 
  • Remote First Policy 
  • Discretionary Time Off, with minimum at 4 weeks of time off
  • 12 US Holidays 
  • 401(k) Matching
  • Pre-Tax Savings Plans, HSA & FSA
  • Carrot and Headspace Subscriptions for Family Planning & Mental Wellness
  • OneMedical Subscription for 24/7 Convenient Medical Care
  • Paid Maternity and Parental Leave for All Family Additions
  • Discounted PetPlan
  • Easy at Home Access to Covid Testing with EmpowerDX 
  • $1,000 Work From Home Stipend to Set Up Your Home Office 

Few companies allow you to thrive like you will at Wurl. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with the industry’s brightest minds and most innovative thinkers. You will enjoy ongoing mentorship, team collaboration and you will have a place to grow your career.  You will be proud to say you're a part of the company revolutionizing TV.

Wurl provides a competitive total compensation package with a pay-for-performance rewards approach. Total compensation at Wurl is based on a number of factors, including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Depending on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical and other benefits.

title: Senior Director of Safety Engineering
description:
Discord is your place to talk. Whether you're part of a school club, gaming group, worldwide art community, or just a handful of friends that want to spend time together, over 150 million people across the world use Discord every day to connect, hang out, and talk.

 

We are excited to be hiring a Senior Director of Safety Engineering to lead and oversee our Safety Engineering team here at Discord. You will play a vital role in ensuring the safety and well-being of our users. Your days will be spent collaborating with other teams to develop new and innovative safety features, proactively identifying and mitigating potential safety risks and issues, and pushing the organization to be the most effective it can be. The ideal candidate for this role will have prior experience in a Safety related field, in-depth knowledge of large online platforms, frameworks, policies, and procedures. If you are passionate about creating a safe and welcoming environment for hundreds of millions of Discord users and committed to protecting their well-being, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity! You will report to the VP of Engineering.

What you'll be doing

  • Lead and oversee the Safety Engineering team, where ensuring the safety and well-being of our users is our top priority. You will provide strategic guidance and technical expertise to the team. 
  • Collaborate with Discord’s Legal, Policy, Product, Marketing, ML, and Security teams to drive the development of client safety features, anti-abuse tools, and large data streams.  
  • Lead interactions with our engineering partners across the company, ensuring Safety is top of mind and is built with privacy in mind.
  • Develop and implement strategies to proactively identify and mitigate potential safety risks and issues using machine learning and artificial intelligence. 
  • Stay up to date with industry trends and best practices in online safety, and apply them to enhance our systems.
  • Foster a positive and inclusive culture within the Safety Engineering team.

What you should have

  • 15+ years in Software Engineering 
  • 5+ years in organizational engineering leadership, managing other Engineering Managers or Directors.
  • Prior experience in a global internet-scale consumer safety engineering or a related field, with a focus on online safety, content moderation, and tooling.
  • In-depth knowledge of safety frameworks, policies, and procedures, and the ability to apply them effectively in an large online community setting.
  • Comfortable with both going deep: i.e. architecture reviews, designing roadmaps and content safety strategies, and presenting long term Trust & Safety plans to C-suite, board of directors, and external policy makers as needed. 
  • Strong leadership skills and the ability to inspire and guide a team.

Bonus Points

  • Understanding and implementation of machine learning in safety spaces

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $342,000 to $376,000 + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role and level. Within the range, individual pay is determined by additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include equity, or benefits.

Benefits and Perks

  • Comprehensive medical insurance including Health, Dental and Vision (plus up to $20,000 for gender affirmation procedures)
  • Mental health resources and quarterly wellness stipends
  • 14+ paid holidays, 4 weeks of PTO + use-what-you-need sick days 
  • Paid parental leave (plus fertility, adoption and other family planning benefits)
  • Flexible long-term work options (remote and hybrid)
  • Volunteer time off
  • A diverse slate of Employee Resource Groups 
  • Plus commuter contributions and other perks for office-based employees

About Us

Discord is a voice, video and text app that helps friends and communities come together to hang out and explore their interests — from artists and activists, to study groups, sneakerheads, plant parents, and more. With 150 million monthly users across 19 million active communities, called servers, Discord has grown to become one of the most popular communications services in the world. Discord was built without selling ads or user data and instead, offers a premium subscription called Nitro that gives users special perks like higher quality streams and fun customizations.

We’re working toward an inclusive world where no one feels like an outsider, where genuine human connection is a click, text chat, or voice call away. A place where everyone can find belonging. Challenging? Heck yes. Rewarding? Double heck yes. It’s a mission that gives us the chance to positively impact millions of people all over the world. So if this strikes a chord with you, come build belonging with us!

title: Partner Operations Manager
description:
About Checkr
Checkr’s mission is to build a fairer future by designing technology to create opportunities for all. We believe all candidates, regardless of who they are, should have a fair chance to work. Established in 2014 and valued at $5B, Checkr is using technology to bring hiring to the next level. Our People Trust Platform uses machine learning to help thousands of companies modernize their background check process and make hiring safer, more efficient, and more inclusive. Some of our customers include Uber, Instacart, Doordash, Netflix, Compass Group, and Adecco.

A career with Checkr is an opportunity to work with some of the best and brightest minds, disrupt an industry for a better future, and give otherwise overlooked candidates access to employment. Checkr has been recognized as one of BuiltIn's 2023 Best Places to Work in the US and is a Y Combinator 2023 Breakthrough Company and Top Company by Valuation.

About the team/role

We’re looking for a Partner Operations Manager to join our Revenue Operations team to help support our rapidly growing partner ecosystem. 

This person will work with Revenue and Product leadership to influence our partner strategy and identify areas of growth for the company. The ideal candidate isn’t afraid of large data sets, can distill insights, make recommendations based on data, and most importantly - drive action from it. 

You don’t just look at the numbers but you understand the greater business context behind them. We’re looking for someone who will have a huge impact. Someone with a mindset of driving efficiency and who’s laser-focused on what’s going to drive results.

What you’ll do

  • Provide insights to help answer key questions to optimize our GTM partner performance (both alliance and channel motions).
  • Define standard reporting, set KPIs, monitor performance, and forecast results for business reviews and annual/long-range planning.
  • Conduct ROI analysis to evaluate new partner deals, the effectiveness of incentive programs, and other partner initiatives. 
  • Look at performance by partner across metrics such as revenue, pipe gen, customer acquisition, conversion rates, etc. and identify areas of opportunity.
  • Play an integral role in helping shape our partner acquisition and expansion strategy.
  • Partner with Business Development, RevOps, and Sales teams to implement any necessary changes to process or reporting infrastructure.

What you bring

  • 5+ years of experience in Go-To-Market operations (partner/sales/rev/biz ops). 
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Comfortable analyzing and visualizing data in Excel/Google Sheets, Salesforce, and BI tools (Looker, Tableau, etc.). 
  • Experience with reporting, modeling, and forecasting business performance.
  • A demonstrated ability to work independently and prioritize across multiple complex  projects in a fast-paced environment. 
  • A strong sense of intellectual curiosity and interest in our partner strategy.
  • Proficiency in our tool stack - Looker, Snowflake, Salesforce - or similar.
  • Intermediate SQL experience preferred.
  • Experience supporting GTM partner operations preferred

What you’ll get

  • A fast-paced and collaborative environment
  • Learning and development allowance
  • Competitive compensation and opportunity for advancement
  • 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Up to $25K reimbursement for fertility, adoption, and parental planning services
  • Flexible PTO policy
  • Monthly wellness stipend, home office stipend

One of Checkr’s core values is Transparency. To live by that value, we’ve made the decision to disclose salary ranges in all of our job postings. We use geographic cost of labor as an input to develop ranges for our roles and as such, each location where we hire may have a different range. If this role is remote, we have listed the top to the bottom of the possible range, but we will specify the target range for an exact location when you are selected for a recruiting discussion. For more information on our compensation philosophy, see our website.

The base salary range for this role is $93,870 to $195,385.

Equal Employment Opportunities at Checkr

Checkr is committed to hiring talented and qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds for all of its tech, non-tech, and leadership roles. Checkr believes that the gathering and celebration of unique backgrounds, qualities, and cultures enriches the workplace.   

Checkr also welcomes the opportunity to consider qualified applicants with prior arrest or conviction records. Checkr’s commitment to diversity extends to hiring talented individuals in spite of a prior criminal history in accordance with local, state, and/or federal laws, including the San Francisco’s Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: Sr. Sales Operations Analyst - Remote US
description:
The Opportunity

Seamless.AI is seeking a talented, proactive, and motivated Senior Sales Operations Analyst who will enable the Account Executive and SDR team to move with speed and deliver results. The Senior Sales Operations Analyst is a member of the broader Revenue Operations team and will act as a business partner to VP of Operations, VP of CSM, and our Chief Revenue Office. This person will report to the Sr. RevOps Manager and work closely with other Sales Operations Analysts to prioritize and drive Sales efficiency. We are looking for a top performer to join our high-growth SaaS company and contribute to our mission to positively impact 1 billion people! 

Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain accuracy of sales dashboards and reports, tailoring them for sales leadership 
  • Analyze data to help drive leadership to improve sales effectiveness and ROI of both SDR and AE teams
  • Understand list building, outbound sales, inbound sales, and sales operation cycles
  • Reviewing capacity, close rate, and performance of sales team data and in turn their commission and quotas
  • Administer all systems used by the sales team, including cross-functional collaboration on systems used throughout the organization (e.g. Salesforce, Salesloft)
  • Support the sales department by answering their operational support questions
  • Experience with generating commission reports or software (Spiff)
  • Manage small-scale sales operations initiatives as a project manager
  • Assist in the audit and assessment of sales pipelines and forecasts and redistribution of leads
  • Optimize sales processes for increased efficiency and productivity for both inbound/outbound SDR and AE teams

The Skill Set

  • Interest in operating in a sales environment without the desire to be a quota-carrying representative
  • Proficiency in the Salesforce ecosystem
  • Data-driven with strong acumen for calculating and analyzing metrics to turn into decisions
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and working through challenges daily
  • Energetic team player that excels in working with others to achieve a common goal
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent excel and salesforce reporting skills

Education & Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree and/or equivalent years of work experience 
  • 3+ years of experience in sales operation or a related analytical role, with a proven track record of driving results

Seamless.AI has been delivering the world's best sales leads since 2015. Our product is the first real time, B2B search engine helping sales teams maximize revenue, increase sales, and easily acquire their total addressable market using artificial intelligence. We have been recognized as one of Ohio’s fastest growing companies and won 2020 Best Places to Work, LinkedIn’s Top 50 Tech Startups in 2020 and 2022, and Purpose Jobs 2023 Best Workplace Culture and Best Work-life balance. title: Frontend Engineer, Near.org Developer Experience
location: Remote - North America, South America, Europe, Africa
description:
About Pagoda

Pagoda is shepherding a future where NEAR becomes the blockchain operating system. We believe that re-inventing how software is made and distributed is our greatest opportunity to open economic access to those who are not fully integrated into the global economy. Our products empower people to find opportunity, invent new experiences, and collaborate. Let's build an Open Web world. A world where people control their assets, data, and power of governance.

About The Role

The Near.org Core Experience team is looking for an experienced Software Engineer to join our effort to enhance near.org with social, collaborative, and engagement features to evolve the near.org developer network to be the best place to build open source software, decentralized UIs, and decentralized applications on the open web ecosystem. 

We are looking for a productive, pragmatic, empathetic collaborator to join the team. Someone who is excited by challenging technical problems, and driven to build performant UIs and collaborate with Designers and User Researchers to build elegant User Experiences. We take a user experience first approach to everything we build so we expect you to develop an understanding of how what you’re working on affects the usability of our target personas of near.org.

What You'll Be Doing

  • Work on a collaborative and globally distributed team of world class experienced engineers, providing an opportunity to learn and grow your technical skill set.
  • Follow the minimal processes, like technical roadmaps, OKRs, milestones, regular team meetings;
  • Working in the open while developing user interfaces on near.org
  • Participate in on-call rotations

What We're Looking For

  • The ability to solve all sorts of frontend engineering tasks
  • Effective communication skills to convey your ideas, discuss technical challenges with team members, and initiative to participate in healthy debates without ego and with an attitude of succeeding together.
  • Creativity to come up with proof of concept from high level design while not knowing all the details;
  • The ability to effectively deliver and receive constructive feedback.
  • Ideally 3+ years experience building interactive production UIs in React
  • Experience integrating with async APIs - data fetching, caching and client-side state management
  • Fluency in Typescript/Javascript and web standards
  • A solid understanding of CSS
  • Bachelor’s Degree in a Science, Arts, or relevant field is a must

We'd Love If You Have

  • Experience working with a fully remote team and the skills to excel at working in a remote environment
  • Open source contributions and previous or continued involvement in open source communities
  • Experience with design systems and components
  • Experience using a CSS-in-JS library
  • Familiarity with other crypto or blockchain technologies
  • Experience working at a startup

Here’s What Our Interview Process Looks Like

Our interviews take place via Zoom and typically consists of the following stages:

  • Internal Recruiter Call (30 to 45 minutes)
  • Meet with the Hiring Manager (45 to 60 minutes)
  • Technical Interviews (3 x 60 minutes) 
  • Pagoda Values Interview (30 to 45 minutes)

Please let us know if you require any special requirements for your interview and we’ll do our best to accommodate.

Compensation

The base salary range for this role is $148,750- $175,000. This reflects the minimum and maximum range across all US locations. This does not include bonus, incentives, or benefits.

The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: leveling, relevant skills, and work location. If you are based outside of the US, there are other geographic considerations that may impact your final compensation. Your recruiter can share more about the compensation and benefits applicable to your preferred location during the hiring process. 

Benefits & Perks

  • Flexible Annual Leave / PTO with an encouraged 20 day per year minimum
  • Paid Holiday Week: the last week of the year
  • Paid Wellness Week: the first week of July
  • $2,000 Yearly Continued Education Reimbursement
  • $2,000 Home Office Setup Reimbursement
  • Co-working Space Reimbursement
  • Company Retreats (2023 in Spain!) & Team Offsites
  • Mental Health Support and access to licensed therapists through Spill, 100% paid by Pagoda 

Our Values at Pagoda

Our values express our company culture. Learn more on our careers page.

Pagoda is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or other legally protected status.

title: Jr. Salesforce Administrator- Remote US
description:
The Opportunity

Seamless.AI is looking for a Junior Salesforce Administrator to play a role in managing Seamless.AI's Salesforce system configurations, integrations, automations, data integrity and day to day end user support and reporting for multiple business functions including Sales, Operations, Marketing, Finance, and Senior Leadership. This support includes intake of requirements through development and delivery of requests. The Salesforce Admin will maintain user roles and profiles, security settings, and access settings all while assisting users with best practices and maintaining the overall strategy of Salesforce within our organization. Join us and help share the best sales leads technology to change the lives of sales people around the world!

 

Responsibilities:

  • Support all aspects of user and license management including new user setup/deactivation, roles, profiles, permissions, public groups, OWD, sharing rules
  • Support Salesforce configuration changes, including (but not limited to): Workflow, Process Builder, Flow, assignment rules, approval processes, fields, page layouts, record types, dynamic layouts, apps, actions, custom settings, mobile administration
  • Build, run, distribute, and support in-depth dashboards, searches, and operational reports to provide insight into data needs for all team functions.
  • Oversee data management to improve Salesforce data quality, implementing deduping rules and automation as needed 
  • Resolve user support tickets, monitoring and improving user adoption
  • Create and maintain technical documentation for Salesforce releases
  • Review upgrades to evaluate the impact on processes, configurations, and customizations. 
  • Work with integrated applications (sales enablement, marketing, lead forms, etc.)
  • Execute data imports and data migrations, including mapping configurations and writing SOQL queries using Data Loader
  • Perform testing in sandbox environments

Skillset:

  • Embraces change, flexible, and can easily adapt to new requests or business use case challenges
  • Ability to analyze complex problems and assess how Salesforce can be utilized to solve them.
  • Self-directed individual who is a self-starter and has the ability to complete assigned tasks independently
  • Strong business process and analytical skills
  • Team player that demonstrates thinning of solutions and flexible
  • Passion for continuous improvement and learning

Education and Requirements:

  • Strong Salesforce product knowledge and at least 1 year of Salesforce Administration with hands-on experience with Sales Cloud and Service Clouds
  • Certified Salesforce Administrator
  • Experience with Salesforce CPQ preferred
  • Lightning Experience Reports & Dashboards Specialist and Process Automation Specialist superbadges is a plus
  • Bachelor's Degree and/or equivalent work experience

What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
  • A dynamic, innovative, and results driven environment. 
  • Collaborative and supportive team atmosphere. 
  • Access to cutting-edge tools and technologies in the digital space.

title: VAR, Sales Engineer
description:
At 8x8 Inc. [Nasdaq:EGHT] we put communications at the heart of our business and
build technology that allows people to connect anytime, anywhere they are in the
world, and on any device. XCaaS
[https://www.8x8.com/products?lever_via=&utm_campaign=7012J000001RrUp&utm_campaign=employee_advocacy&utm_medium=social-media&utm_medium=social-media-organic&utm_source=advocates&utm_source=None]
- the 8x8 eXperience Communications Platform - brings together Employee and
Customer Experience, enabling hybrid workforces across the globe to connect,
collaborate, and delight customers, while providing businesses with real-time
communications analytics, intelligence and unique insights.
 
Learn more on our company website at www.8x8.com [http://www.8x8.com/] and
follow our pages on LinkedIn [https://www.linkedin.com/company/8x8/], Twitter
[https://twitter.com/8x8] and Facebook [https://www.facebook.com/8x8Inc/].


At 8x8, Sales Engineers are vital technical resources with great technical and
sales acumen. Sales Engineers act as key technical advisors and product
advocates while managing the technical evaluation and demonstration stages of
the sales process.  Working closely with direct and channel sellers, they must
be able to technically qualify opportunities and clearly explain and position
8x8 products to technical and non-technical audiences in a way that emphasizes
customer satisfaction. 


To accomplish this effectively, SE's must build and maintain strong
relationships internally within 8x8 and with resellers, their customers, and
their prospects.


The VAR SE role will be a resource specifically dedicated to support key 8x8
resellers in North America.  They will work closely with the 8x8 Channel
organization and the resellers' sales teams to help them provide qualification,
product positioning, advanced demonstrations, and technical answers to their
prospects and customers. 


WHAT YOU'LL DO

 * Present industry, technical, and product knowledge to customers and 8x8 VARs.
 * Develop and maintain an expert understanding of all 8x8 applications and
   products.
 * Keep up to date with competitor solutions and services. 
 * Provide technical and sales support for assigned 8x8 North America resale
   program participants. 
 * Advocate for 8x8 Resale partner’s within 8x8 as technical sales needs arise
 * Perform advanced technical presentations and demonstrations for customers,
   and prospects remotely and/or in person. 
 * Develop advanced system configurations to provide a customized demo
   experience.
 * Represent 8x8 at conferences, industry, and sales events when requested.
 * Provide direct support for the functional and technical fulfillment of RFI's
   and RFP's.
 * Coordinate with 8x8 Channel Sales to enable the continued education of the
   8x8 Resale Partnership participants on the 8x8 platform and roadmap.
 * Able to convey customer requirements to Product Management through defined
   processes.
 * Able to travel throughout sales territory by air and car.
 * Manage and support product workshops as per company policy.
 * Ability to travel up to 25% of the time within the region to accommodate
   resale partner events, meetups, and / or customer engagements.


WE'D LOVE IF YOU BROUGHT THESE SKILLS:

 * Sales Engineering experience in selling cloud Contact Center (CCaaS)
   services.
 * Sales Engineering experience in selling cloud Unified Communications (UCaaS).
 * Sales Engineering experience in selling AI based Bot / NLP solutions to
   customers.
 * Requires an action-oriented individual with a very strong initiative to be
   successful.


YOU HAVE THESE SKILLS:

 * 3 to 5 years Sales Engineering experience in selling Contact Center
   services. 
 * 3 to 5 years Sales Engineering experience in Unified Communications.
 * Ability to provide technical leadership to 8x8 Channel Sales and resale
   partners..
 * Ability to work effectively on a remote basis. 
 * Ability to deliver customized demos to prospects with agility and sales
   finesse.
 * Willingness to take ownership of accounts and account-related actions. 
 * Must be able to coordinate across various groups and functional teams both
   within and outside of 8x8. 
 * Demonstrates ability to implement, drive and track projects.
 * Ability to apply technology and 8x8 products to business opportunities in
   creative ways.
 * Strong verbal and written communication skills focused on needs analysis,
   positioning, business justification, and closing techniques.
 * Superior presentation skills.

*The compensation range reflects the Company’s good faith belief at the time of
posting. 8x8 has different base pay ranges for different work locations within
the United States, which allows us to pay employees competitively and
consistently in different geographic markets. The range above reflects the
potential base pay across the U.S. for this role; the applicable base pay range
will depend on what ultimately is determined to be the candidate’s primary work
location. Further, individual base pay depends on various factors, in addition
to primary work location, such as complexity and responsibility of role, job
duties/requirements, and relevant experience, knowledge, success, education and
skills. Base pay ranges are reviewed and typically updated each year. Offers are
made within the base pay range applicable at the time. Certain roles are
eligible for additional rewards, including discretionary merit increases, bonus
and/or stock. Certain roles have the opportunity to earn sales variable
compensation incentives based on the terms of the plan and the employee’s role.
